12113221111212221112111211.content:
<John>
I awoke with a start as I felt something wrap around my body. Adrianna had opened the cage and had grabbed me while I was still asleep. By the look on her face, I knew she had something planned for me. I remained silent as she walked to the bathroom and dropped me on the sink counter. I looked up to see a wicked smile spread across her face.
“Alright, little Johnny, here’s what you’re going to do today. I seemed to have ‘accidentally’ dropped one of my favorite earrings down the shower drain. You’re going to go get it for me.”
“What!? I’m not crawling through some stupid drain! No way!” Her finger shot out of nowhere and pinned me to the counter, pressing down on the exact spot where I had been burned. I cried out in pain and struggled to get free, but I wasn’t strong enough.
“Listen here, bug, you either do this or wind up a John Smithson smoothie! Don’t think that I’m above killing you, little man! So what’s it going to be? Huh?”
She released me and I just nodded my head out of fear.
“Good. That’s what I thought you would do.” She picked me up and carried me over to the shower, setting me down on the tub floor near the drain. Then she pulled out a long coil of nylon thread and handed one end to me.
“Tie this to your waist. Oh, and take your shirt and pants off.”
“I am not taking my pants off!” I said as I pulled my shirt off over my head and slipped off my shoes.
“Fine, suit yourself and get drain mold all over your only clothes. Now hurry up; I have things I want to do.”
I had a few rude words to respond to that, but I held my tongue and tied the string end around my waist. Adrianna pulled the cap off the drain and motioned for me to descend into its depths. I gulped as I stared at the black hole. I had never really been afraid of tight spaces, but this was extreme. I yelped in surprise as I was suddenly lifted into the air. Adrianna had picked up the string and raised me up.
“I would go in head first if I was you,” she said with a sneer.
“Whatever, b****,” I said very quietly so that she wouldn’t hear me. She lowered me towards the drain and I leaned forward so that I was going head first into the dark hole. I took one last look around me before I entered the darkness and was cut off from the light. For a few seconds I was suspended in midair with just the drain walls around me. I stuck my hands out in front of my head to feel the bottom of the drain when it came. Finally, I felt the cold metal against my fingers. I came to rest on my belly at the bottom of the drain. It was cold and wet and smelled of mold and rotting substances. I plugged my nose for a moment and calmed myself to prepare for what I was about to do. With a deep breath, I began crawling forward, sweeping my hands side to side to feel for the lost earring. My hand struck something wet and gooey and made a sickening squelch sound. I resisted the urge to gag and tried not to think of what it was.
The pipe was big enough for me to crawl on all fours with my back scraping the top slightly. The smell was horrible, but bearable. It was worst when I passed one of the piles of gooey sludge. I shivered in disgust each time my hand was buried in the gunk. A sticky strand of some kind suddenly attached itself to my face. I backed away, gagging as I realized that it was old hair. Didn’t these people ever clean their shower pipes? I pushed the hair out of the way and continued on. It was silent except for the sound of my breathing and the occasional squash as I crawled through the slimy goo.
Then my worst fear came upon me. The pipe began to thin out until I could no longer crawl on all fours, but was forced to army crawl if I wanted to get through. I stopped there and took a deep breath. I had to do this, or else Adrianna would surely kill me. It was not impossible; I could do it. With another deep breath, I continued forward, trying to ignore the panic that was growing inside of me. The pipe continued to get smaller and smaller. Army crawling now took up too much space. I put my arms to my sides and inched my way forward like a worm. The pipe pushed in all around me on all sides. My heart was beating fiercely as I wiggled my way forward. Suddenly, my shoulders lodged in the pipe and I couldn’t move. The panic that I had been fighting down finally broke through.
I struggled and thrashed, trying to get free, crying out in fear. It was too much, too much! It was too tight for me; I had gotten myself trapped, trapped in eternal darkness! It was as if all the forces of hell had begun to push down on my body, inclosing me in a grave of cold, wet metal. “NO! NOOO!” I cried out, bursting into tears. “Please, no…”
It was as if I had died. I was trapped in a grave, unable to move with nobody to help me. The cruel reality of life had caught up to me. I would surely die here, rotting until my bones were swept away into the sewer system, never to be seen again.
“AARRRGGGHHH!” I bellowed out, the sound echoing off the pipe walls until it faded away, leaving only the sound of my weeping to accompany me. Maybe this was hell. Instead of a lake of fire, hell was a cold lifeless expanse where you spent the rest of eternity in perpetual darkness, alone and unable to move.
I lay there, silently weeping. I had given up. What use was there to living anyway? Down here was death and up on the surface was death. At least down here I would die quicker and I did not have to suffer the cruelty of Adrianna. But, no, I couldn’t give up; I had to stay alive for Melissa and Ron. I owed it to them to fight for my life. I had gotten into this; surely I could find some way out.
I took deep steady breaths, pushing down my fears and relaxing my body. My tense shoulders relaxed and loosed from the pipe. I wiggled my way forward, elated that I was no longer trapped. The smelly goo stuck to my face as I crawled through it but I continued to fight my way forward; I was going to get out of here. The hair wrapped around me like spider webs weighed down with water.
Suddenly, I came upon a particularly large pile of goo. It blocked my path and I had to crawl straight into it to get through. I wriggled my way forward, using my head to push aside the gross muck. Then my head hit something solid. I paused for a moment, trying to figure out what it was. It rubbed against my head as I nodded from side to side to feel it. I moved forward slightly and touched the object with my chin and cheek. It was the earring! My heart leapt for joy at the realization. Now I just had to get it out of here.
I thought for a moment on how I was going to get it out. I couldn’t grab it with my hands. Disgusted that I had no other option, I opened my mouth and bit down on the earring, securing it in my teeth. It tasted beyond nasty, like rotten fruit, dirty feet, and sweat mixed together. I got over the gag reflex and began wiggling my way backwards. The pipe began to widen and I breathed easier, the panic lifting as I gained more room to move. Soon, I could army crawl again and I immediately took the earring out of my mouth, spitting out the disgusting taste as best as I could. Suddenly, I felt the thread tied around my waist tighten. Then I was being pulled backwards; Adrianna was pulling me out. I slid along the slick surface of the pipe like it was ice, probably because I had so much goo stuck to me. I kept my body as rigid as possible as I felt myself being lifted into the air and then light, glorious light! It shone upon me like the light of heaven. I had never felt so relieved.
Adrianna set me down on the tub bottom and took the earring from my hand.
“Thank you, Johnny,” she said with false sweetness. “This is from my favorite pair of plastic earrings.”
I looked up at her in disbelief. I hope you get eaten by wolves someday, I thought to myself as I lay there in the tub. But at least I wasn’t down in the drain. I had never realized how claustrophobic I really was until now and I really hoped that I wouldn’t have to do anything like that again. I looked back at Adrianna, waiting for what she would have me do next. Man, I hated that b****.
~Torch~

<John>
I undid the string around my waist as I watched Adrianna wrinkle her nose in disgust.
“Gosh, you smell! You are definitely taking a bath!” She reached down and picked me up, sticking out her tongue in revulsion. She walked to her room and grabbed something off one of her shelves. It looked like an old pickle jar with leaves and grass scattered in it, probably for some poor bug that she had caught and then let perish in her room. Adrianna walked down the stairs and took a right, entering a kitchen/dining area. She walked to the garbage and emptied the contents of the jar before rinsing it out briefly in water. Then she set it down in the sink and dropped me in it. I stood up in the glass jar and looked up at her as she walked away and came back carrying small objects in her hands. She dropped them into the jar and I realized that they were ice cubes.
“There; some toys for little Johnny to play with while he takes his bath.”
Before I could protest, she screwed the metal lid with holes drilled into it onto the jar and moved the faucet head until it was directly over me. Then she turned it on so that a small stream of water began pouring out. It immediately began seeping through the holes at the top of the jar and I jumped backward as the water hit me; it was very cold. The water pooled up at my feet and began filling the jar. Fear welled up within me as I realized what she was doing. Through the blurred vision of the glass, I saw her put something on top of the jar lid. Soon, the water that was flowing in began to produce bubbles. That b**** had put liquid soap on top of the jar!
The water was now up past my ankles and it was frigid cold. The ice cubes had began to float on top of the water, churning in the little waves produced by the falling water. Goosebumps rose on my arms and legs, causing the hair to stick straight out. Soon it was up to my knees and the bubbles had risen to my waist.
This was not good. Was she going to drown me? I frantically looked around as the water rose to my waist. There was no way I could get out of this jar on my own. I turned and banged on the glass walls as the water rose over my stomach.

I could smell the gasoline from the two cars parked there and all the dust and dirt from the overhanging rafters and shelves. Old junk was piled up on the shelves and rafters in an unorganized clutter and a bunch of old spider webs hung in every corner of the place.
I sat up and pulled my legs close to me, trying to keep warm. Then I heard a door open and two people walked up to the bench that I was on. It was Adrianna and a young girl of around 9 years old. Both were wearing thick sweaters due to the cold.

I jumped from side to side to avoid the hammer blows, but then the two girls came at me together, one at each side. I ran to the left to escape but my foot hit a rut in the old wood and I fell on my chest. I turned in time to see a single hammer coming towards me like a rushing bull. I was doomed.

I followed Caesar down the hallway. His room was at the very end in a nearly soundproof room so that he could stay up late and run his experiments without keeping everyone else awake. It used to be John’s dad’s room and workshop when John’s mom was out of town. His dad liked to experiment with things in his free time.
Caesar held the door open for me and I walked into the chaotic mess that was his room. It was like a tornado had swept through the place and had thrown every object this way and that. Nothing about it was organized from the computer on the floor, to the vials and equipment on the dresser and table, to the clothes hanging from the ceiling fan. Honestly, I didn’t understand Caesar.
“The thing I want to show you is in the closet,” he said. The ‘closet’ was a small closet about 5 ft by 5 ft and was used for storing clothes. Since it was Caesar, I really didn’t think it strange that he would put something other than clothes in it. I walked to the closet and opened the door, expecting to see some strange new machine or device that he had created. Instead, to my complete surprise, the closet was empty. I was just about to ask him what I was supposed to see when I felt a strong shove force me into the closet. Soon I was encased in darkness as the door was closed. I frantically felt for the doorknob and tried to force the door open, but something large was now blocking it. I banged on the door, yelling at Caesar to let me out. “Get me out of here! What are you doing? Caesar!” But all I heard was the sound of his laughter.
<Caesar>
I had successfully trapped the girl in the closet. Now I could make off with my prized possession. I entered John’s room and picked him up, startling him awake, but I moved too fast for him to react. I placed him in the special carrying case I had designed for him. He frantically tried to get away, but that’s when I gassed the case with a special serum. John immediately fell asleep from the gas. Not only did it help keep him out of stress, it also allowed his body to survive the plane ride down to Europe where my lab was hidden. I had lots planned for little John.
<John>
I woke up lying on something soft and warm. I didn’t quite feel like my bed, but it was comfortable. I opened my eyes and gasped. I was in a small room, lying on what looked like a miniature cot. The room had three solid walls and then one wall made entirely out of glass. It opened up into what looked like a massive lab, with strange-looking technology and computers all around. I got up out of the cot and limped to the glass window. Just then, a man in a white lab coat approached me; it was Caesar! In an instant, all my memories came flooding back to me.
“You! What do you want with me?” I yelled.
Caesar chuckled. “Well, John, I have taken you to my lab in Europe so that I can finish the experiment that I started long ago. You see, it was I who injected you and your family with the nanobots. I had created the ability to shrink living creatures, but only by injecting them with the nanobots. Seventy percent of the creatures that I experimented on didn’t live.”
“Like my family!” I snarled. He paused and looked at me.
“It was all for the greater good. You see, I wanted to create a serum that would allow me to shrink anyone at any given time without the risk of them dying. That’s where you come in. You and your family are of a rare blood type that can produce a special type of antibodies. With my nanobots, I can use these antibodies that your body produces to shrink others. It is a brilliant plan, don’t you think?”
“You’re insane!”
“All the great minds are.”
I shook my head. “No. You’re not brilliant, you’re just evil! I want you to make me normal again!”
Caesar laughed. “Oh, John, even if I had wanted to make you normal, I couldn’t. The nanobots shrunk you using a special electrical pulse. At your size, a reverse pulse would kill you. Sorry,” he said and walked away out of my sight. I slid down and sat on the floor, stunned by what I had just heard. I would be stuck like this, forever? I hugged my knees as I looked down at the floor. How could this have happened? Why was he even doing this? What did he gain by having this ability? He was messing with human lives!
I looked up as Caesar walked past the window. “Get some rest, John. I want your body to heal so that it will produce the antibodies that I need. That’s why I took you away from your home. You had been under too much stress; now I can actually get things done without having to worry about you being killed. This would have been a lot easier if my former assistant had just done what he was told and taken you directly to the lab! Stupid Nathan! I’m glad that stupid dog sent him to the hospital!”
He walked off again, leaving me alone. So that was it? I was just going to stay in this box until he got what he wanted from me? Then what? I got up and limped back over to the cot and sat down with a sigh. Again, I was a prisoner. At least this time I wouldn’t be tortured or starved, or so I hoped.
~Torch~

<Melissa>
John’s house had a furnace system that always kept the house at a comfortable 70 degrees, but the closet I was in did not receive any of the heat; it was freezing inside. I did everything in my power to try and open the door, slamming into it with my shoulder enough times to wrench it out of place, but nothing worked. I figured that Caesar had moved one of the large dressers in front of it. After a few hours I had given up and sat down in defeat, hugging my knees and trying to keep warm from the chilly air. Sometime later I had fallen asleep; the exhaustion of not sleeping for days on end had finally caught up to me. When I woke up, I was still in darkness, but I felt refreshed and renewed, except for the fact that I really had to go use the bathroom and I was extremely hungry. I didn’t know how long I had spent there but I was getting tired of being trapped in the small space.
Suddenly, I heard someone’s voice in the distance. They were calling out my name. I yelled out, frustrated that I was in a sound proof room, but was relieved when I heard someone open the bedroom door. I called out to whoever it was and then I heard grunting as a large object was being moved. The closet door opened and I blinked, shielding my eyes from the light as I looked at Ron. He helped me to my feet and the first thing I did was run to the bathroom. When I came out, he started barraging me with questions.
“What happened to you? Where’s Caesar? Where’s John!? Why didn’t you call me?”
“Slow down, slow down!” I said. “Caesar locked me in the closet and my cell phone was in my room. I don’t know where John is and I don’t know where Caesar is. I think he kidnapped John.”
Ron ran his fingers through his hair and began to pace back and forth. I noticed that he had a slight limp in his left leg.
“It’s been three days since I last talked to you,” Ron said. I could hear the worry in his voice. “Where would Caesar have taken John?”
“I don’t know. Maybe back to his lab in Europe?”
“That could be.”
“But how are we supposed to find him?”
“I have a pretty good idea,” Ron replied. “I just hope we get there in time.”
<John>
I had spent three days in the little room and I have to say, it was extremely boring. There was nothing in the room except for the cot and a miniature bathroom. Caesar fed me three times a day, but other than that, I had no contact with anyone. The isolation was starting to drive me up a wall. On the other hand, my health had improved greatly. I was amazed at how fast my leg was healing; I could now put some of my weight onto it without being in too much pain. My burns had faded along with my bruises and the cigarette burns had finally started to turn into scars. I was no longer completely exhausted and I had started to get some more meat onto my bones; my ribs didn’t show anymore. It was on the beginning of the fourth day that Caesar once again approached me.
“Ahh, and how is Mr. Smithson doing today?” he said as he approached the cell window. I turned away from him and ignored him, burning with hatred toward him for what he had done to me.
“I see that you have become much healthier. That is very good news. Your body should produce the antibodies I need in no time!”
“And then what?” I said bitterly. “I become disposable like my family?”
“Heavens no! You’re much too valuable to lose. But I think staying in this cell is bad for you. You should be ready to join the colony.”
“The what?” I said and looked at him. He pulled out a remote and pushed a button on it. A door opened in the far wall from the window.
“Follow where that door leads to and you’ll get your next meal,” Caesar said and then left. I looked at the passageway. It was lit and had white walls, just like everything else. I had no idea where it led to, but I was hungry enough to go find out.
I stood up from the cot and limped to the door and entered the passageway. As soon as I did, the door closed behind me. Well there’s no turning back now, I thought to myself as I continued forward. The path led downwards and I was glad for that because it was easier for me to walk. Finally, the passageway ended with another door that opened when I approached. I limped through the door and it closed behind me, leaving me to gasp at my surroundings. I was in a large circular chamber with a large white light dominating the ceiling high above me. Different numbered doors like the one I had just exited out of lined the walls. But what really surprised me was what was in the center of the chamber. It wasn’t exactly a city; there were no buildings, but there were distinguished areas like an area for exercising, complete with a track and a basketball hoop, an area for dining filled with tables and chairs, and an area for lounging on couches and recliners. And spread throughout this miniature city was at least twenty people, all my size.
They stopped what they were doing and stared at me when I appeared. Immediately, I became nervous. I had no idea how to react; it was like I was about to deliver a speech. Then one person stepped out from the group and approached me.
“John? John, is that really you?” the person said. I recognized the voice and the face but I didn’t believe what I was seeing. The person was an old friend of mine. He was medium built with green eyes and light blond hair that was shaved short. His ears stuck out from the sides and his face was covered in freckles; he was one of the people you never forgot.
“Kendall?” I said in amazement. He ran up to me and gave me a bear hug, much to my surprise and agony.
“Ok, ok! You’re crushing my still healing body!”
“Sorry,” he said and released me. “I just can’t believe someone I knew is here!”
“Are you really Kendall Jacobs?” I asked. “I thought you were dead. I mean, I even went to your funeral!”
“Yeah, it’s me. I’ve been here for a little over a year.” He suddenly got very serious. “How’s my family doing? Is my mom ok? What about my younger brother and my dad?”
I shook my head. “I don’t know. They were really upset at your death. They thought you committed suicide. The police found your car in a lake and your mom found a note saying that you were going to kill yourself. They just never found your body.”
“Caesar did all that to me. He kidnapped me to use for his experiments, not caring who he hurt in the process.”
“Why would he need you? Why would he need anyone here?”
“He was looking for the right blood type, the right person with the right antibodies. All of us here have the rare blood type that he was looking for, but none of us were able to produce the right antibodies. He keeps us here in case he needs the antibodies our bodies do produce. What about you? Why are you here?”
“I think my blood is the right type, antibodies and all.”
“That’s not good,” Kendall said. “Good for you because you’re now indispensable, but bad for the rest of society. This guy’s a madman.”
“Yeah, I kind of figured that.”
“Come on; I’ll introduce you to everyone else.”
I followed Kendall, limping because of my bad leg. He introduced me to everyone in the colony, and most greeted me warmly. A lot of them were shy and didn’t say much, but a few were just as energetic as Kendall. When the introductions were done, Kendall and I sat on two of the recliners in the lounge area. I propped my leg up and leaned back with a sigh; walking still took a lot of energy out of me.
“What happened to you?” Kendall asked. “I haven’t seen anyone so badly wounded since Mary showed up after being kidnapped.”
I told him all that I had experienced, including the torture I had received from Adrianna.
“Adrianna? I knew that girl was a b****, but I didn’t know that she was a b****!”
“Yeah, but now she has no hair and second degree burns on her scalp.”
We both laughed at that. The day passed by and Kendall and I ate and talked together. Finally, a voice rang out from hidden speakers, interrupting us.
“All subjects report to your rooms,” the voice said. I recognized it as Caesar’s. Kendall led me to one of the doors with numbers on them.
“I think this one is yours,” he said. “Mine’s right next to it.”
The door opened as I approached and I looked at Kendall before walking in. He peeked around the door and smiled at me. “Sleep tight! Don’t let the giant bedbugs suck all your blood!”
He laughed and then said, “I’ll see you in the morning. This is our home now. You better get used to it because we’ll probably be here until the day we drop dead. Good night.”
The door closed as he left and I stood there, frozen at the thought of his words. What had my life come to?
~Torch~

<John>
All I saw was a vortex of white as I tumbled through the air. I didn’t know what I would hit, but I was sure hoping that I would survive. I didn’t want to go through the trouble of trying to escape and then end up dying anyway. To my relief, I landed on something soft and springy. I bounced in the air a couple times before coming to rest on what felt like a massive pile of blankets. I pushed myself up with my arms and looked around, seeing that I was on a normal sized bed. It was then that I heard the scream.
“AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!”
It felt like knives were being shoved into my skull. I covered my ears with my hands and closed my eyes as the sound grated on me like a tornado siren. I swear, some people in Canada had to have heard that scream. When the noise ended, I opened my eyes and uncovered my ears, looking to see where the scream had come from. What I saw nearly made me pass out from shock.
“JENNY?!” I yelled in disbelief. There was my younger sister, standing at the side of the bed, staring at me with wide eyes and her hands covering her mouth. She bent down at the bedside as I sat there, trying to make sense of what I was seeing.
“John? Is that you? Am I dreaming?” She pinched her arm in response to her own question. “Ouch! I’m not dreaming, but are you real?” Her finger shot out towards me, stabbing me in the stomach. I pushed her finger away and doubled over in pain.
“Don’t do that! I’m still healing!” I looked up at her. “I thought…I thought you were dead.”
“But I thought you were dead,” Jenny said as tears began to well up in her eyes. “You can’t be real.” She reached out her hand again and I flinched, expecting to get jabbed again, but instead she ran her finger gently down my back. I could feel her shaking as she confirmed that I was real. She wrapped her fingers around my body and lifted me into the air. I didn’t flinch as she drew me close to her, hugging me against her chest. I hugged her back the best I could, trying to keep myself from crying. My sister was alive!
She pulled me back and set me down on the bed again, resting her chin on the edge as she continued to look at me. “How’d you get so small?” she asked.
“I’ll get to that,” I replied. “First tell me why you thought I was dead? I saw your body! I saw the heart monitor go blank! I even saw you get buried with mom and dad! How are you alive?!”
“I was the other mound?” Jenny said. “The only thing I remember is waking up in the back of a car and looking out to see a big gravestone with our name on it. I saw the three mounds and I thought…I thought…” Her tears began spotting the bed sheets as I realized what she was thinking.
“You thought I had died?” She nodded in response. “No, no it wasn’t me, but I saw your body! I saw…”
But she might not have been dead. There had been reported cases of people supposedly ‘dying’ but were not actually dead. Come to think of it, her body had been a little pinker than mom and dad’s.
“How did you wind up here?” I asked.
“There was some guy in the car with me, a guy with thick eyebrows and a hooked nose. I wanted to go to the graves as soon as I saw them, but the guy kept me under restraints.”
“Nathan. He probably switched out your body in the hearse and filled the casket with something to replace your weight! He did always seem familiar. I bet he was the hearse driver!”
“Well, he took me here, and this really nice guy named Caesar gave me this room and gave me anything that I wanted, except to be let go. I’ve been here ever since. What about you? You’re supposed to be my big brother!”
“And you’re supposed to be my little sister, but I guess not anymore. Caesar did this to me. Apparently I’m one of his experiments. He wants to use me to make other people this big.”
“Why? What would he gain from that?”
“That’s exactly what I said!” I had always been amazed at Jenny’s maturity for her age. She was 5 years younger than I was, but was still extremely smart. I could talk to her like an individual my age.
“Why you?” she asked.
“He says that I have the right blood type to produce the antibodies he needs. I’m just a tool to him.”
“So he killed mom and dad?!” she said. “All this time he was telling me that they died from some terrible disease that I had managed to live through! Ba*****!”
“Jenny!” I said.
“Sorry,” she blushed. “But he’s a jerk! I cried myself to sleep every night for two weeks straight! Now it just hurts too much for tears to be enough.”
She looked down and wiped her eyes with the back of her sleeve.
“Jenny, you have no idea how good it feels to see you alive,” I said, my voice breaking a little. “I’ve lost so much in the past months…”
“I know, John. I feel the same. But now how are we going to get out of here? We need to get out and find a way to change you back to normal!”
I looked away from her. “Caesar said that there’s no way to change me back,” I said bitterly. “I’ll be stuck like this for the rest of my life, which at the rate that things have been going, won’t be very long.”
“John, don’t think like that! There has to be a way!”
“I guess. I don’t know. All I know is that we need to get out of here. I was trying to escape from the colony when I fell into your room.”
“The colony? What’s that?”
“Don’t you know? Caesar has this whole little group of small people that he’s taken captive. We were trying to get out. That’s how I got here.”
“Why didn’t he tell me any of these things? I mean, he acted like…”
Just then the door opened with a click and I saw the last person I wanted to see. Caesar walked into the room and Jenny grabbed me, hiding me behind her back as she quickly jumped onto the bed, but Caesar had already seen.
“What do you have there, Jenny?”
“Nothing!” Jenny said, but she had always been horrible at lying. Caesar walked over and grabbed her arm, pulling me out of her hand.
“John! How did you get here? You’re supposed to be in the colony!”
“Yeah, like I’m going to stay your slave!” I spat. “Let me go!”
“I can’t do that, John.”
“You lied to me!” Jenny yelled. “You said my whole family was dead! You never told me that you had done…this to John! And you did it to more than just him! How can you live with yourself?!”
“That’s enough, Jenny,” Caesar said sternly. He looked down at me as I was clenched in his fist. My arms were pinned to my side or else I would have flipped him off. “I knew I shouldn’t have put you in the colony,” Caesar stated. “You were helping them to escape, weren’t you? Very well, you will now stay with Jenny. That should keep you out of trouble.”
He dropped me on the bed and walked back to the door. Caesar turned around before he closed the door and said, “Oh, and you can be sure that I’ll fix the air vents so you can’t get out. Don’t think I didn’t know how you escaped. I am not naïve. This is your new home, John, so get used to it.”
He closed the door and I heard an audible lock. I sighed and looked at Jenny. She wiped the last of the tears from her eyes and reached over to me before I could react. I jumped a little as she picked me up and let me rest in the palm of her hand.
“What are we going to do, John?”
“I don’t know. I just hope that Ron and Melissa find out where we are and come and get us out of here. I suppose we just hang out here while we wait. There’s nothing we can do right now.”
“I guess. We should probably get some sleep,” Jenny said. She looked around her room for a moment. “You can sleep on my nightstand,” she said and set me down on the wooden stand next to her bed. She pulled a thin blanket off of her bed and bunched it up into a sort of nest-type-thing and set it down next to me.
“Sorry, John,” she said. “That’s the best I can do.”
“It’s perfect,” I said with a smile. I climbed into the sheet and lay on my back, staring at the ceiling. Out of the corner of my eye I saw Jenny stand up and flick the light switch, engulfing the room in darkness. I could see very little, but as my eyes adjusted, I could see fairly well. I heard Jenny climb into bed and pull the covers over her.
“Goodnight, John,” she whispered.
“Goodnight,” I replied, so happy to hear her voice again.
<Jenny>
I woke up still in darkness. The alarm clock on my dresser glowed 1:30 A.M. I turned and looked at my brother, sleeping soundly in the bed that I had made him. Nothing could describe what I felt knowing that he was alive. He was small enough for someone to crush him in their hands, but I didn’t care. I cared because he was my brother, yes, but I was happier that he was alive. If only there was something I could do to help him.
I shivered slightly. Caesar always kept things cold; it drove me nuts some nights. I watched as John mumbled something and rolled over in his sleep, drawing the covers closer to him as he shivered. I reached over and touched his back. He was very cold. Gently, I lifted him up, being careful not to wake him. I drew him close to me and cradled him in my hand. I could feel his tiny heart beating in his chest through my fingers. He soon stopped shivering and started to snore slightly. I laughed quietly to myself and closed my eyes, dreaming of mom and dad and John normal sized as I drifted back to sleep.
~Torch~
12113221111212221112111211121212221.title: You're alive?!?!

121132211112122211121112111212122212.content:
<Melissa>
I sat looking out the window of the plane, watching the clouds pass by underneath us. It had been four hours since Ron and I had tracked down Nathan. I had never seen Ron so fierce. He had stormed into Nathan’s apartment and kicked the door open. Nathan had tried to run but had grabbed him by the chest and slammed him against the wall.
“Where is Caesar’s lab?!” Ron had demanded, but Nathan refused to speak. I had watched as Ron slammed his fist again and again into Nathan's face until it was bloody and swollen. Finally, Nathan cracked.
“Ok, ok! His lab is in the Alps, at the base of Mont Blanc near the city of Courmayeur Aosta! That’s all I can tell you! The exact coordinates are programmed into my GPS in my car. Take it and just please leave me alone!”
Now we were in the Smithson’s private jet, heading towards Italy. I was scared for John; I had no idea what Caesar had planned for him. I just hoped and prayed that we got there in time.
<John>
Slowly, I began to drift out of sleep. I had been dreaming about something concerning me driving a Jaguar. I don’t know why; I prefer Lamborghinis. The first thing I noticed was that I was surrounded by something warm. I opened my eyes to see that I was encased in darkness. My arms were pinned to my sides and I couldn’t move. I began panicking, squirming as I tried to get free. Then I felt whatever was encasing me come apart. I fell onto something soft and realized that I was on Jenny’s bed and she was looking down at me with concern.
“John, are you ok? Did I hurt you?” she asked.
“Yeah…yeah, I’m fine. I just didn’t know where I was for a moment.”
“Sorry, it was really cold last night. I didn’t want you freezing.”
“It’s ok, thanks. It’s just that throughout the past few weeks, well…I haven’t exactly had the most pleasant experiences. It’s making me a little paranoid.”
Jenny giggled. “Little! He hee!”
“Oh, shut up!” I said with a smile. She picked me up and rested me in her palm. Just then, the door opened and Caesar walked in.
“Alright, Jonathan. It’s time for your testing.”
“No way! I’m not going with you!” I spat. “Crazy bas….uh…jerk!”
“You really don’t have a choice,” Caesar replied. “Hand him over, Jenny, or I will take him by force and he could be harmed.”
“Fine you S.O.B.,” she said and held me out to him. Caesar grabbed me and carried me out of the room. I looked back at Jenny as she stared at me in worry before the door closed. Caesar took me to a metal table and set me down in a chair my size. Then he pulled out a needle, even smaller than the one he had used before on me.
“Now I can finally complete my experiment!” he said as he made towards me with the needle. I stood up out of the chair and backed away.
“If you think that I’m just going to give you my blood, think again!” I yelled.
“If you don’t cooperate, I will anesthetize you,” he warned. “I’m going to get your blood either way, John. So what’s it going to be?”
I raised my hand and flipped him off, but I sat back down in the chair and stayed still. He stuck the needle in my arm and began drawing out my blood. I watched in sick fascination as the red liquid filled the needle slowly. This time, he took twice as much, enough to make me light-headed, but not enough to really harm me.
“There! That wasn’t so bad now was it?” he said as he stared in satisfaction at the blood. “Now I will be able to isolate your antibodies and use them to create the serum I need!”

He picked me up and carried me back to Jenny’s room. Jenny was waiting at the door for me. She immediately took me in her hands and walked away from Caesar, calling him a few coarse words.
“Are you ok, John? Did he hurt you?” Jenny demanded from me.
“No, he just drew blood. I’m fine.”
“But now he had your antibodies, right?”
“Yeah. He has what he wanted from me. I just don’t know how soon the serum will be ready.”
“This isn’t good; he shouldn’t have the power to do this to people.”
“There’s nothing we can do about it,” I said sadly.
<Caesar>
Success! I had John’s blood and was now ready to complete the formula I had started so long ago. My body shook with excitement as I isolated the antibodies of the blood and applied it to my formula. The finished product was a bright orange color. Now I just had to decide what to test it on. I could test it on animals but I wanted to see its effects on humans.
Just then, the alarms started going off. I walked to the security console and turned off the alarms. The cameras showed that two people had just entered the top floor of the facility. Since my lab had four floors all underground, it would take them awhile to find me. I zoomed in on the intruders, curious as to whom they were. My mouth spread into a wide smile. It looked like I had found my test subjects.
<Melissa>
It took us two hours to find the entrance to the lab. It was hidden in a cleft of rock and blocked by a large metal door. Using a keycard that he had taken from Nathan’s possessions, Ron had opened the door and we entered the lab. It was immediately obvious that we had entered a labyrinth of white hallways and rooms. The place was bear except for a few computers and tubes containing strange liquids. Boxes were piled in the corner of the first room that we entered and a few rooms had tables and chairs in them.
“Stay close to me,” Ron said. “We don’t want to get separated.”
I nodded and followed Ron to a staircase that led downwards. When we reached the landing and stepped into the hallway, two metal walls slammed down in front of us and behind us. Ron pushed against one of the walls, but was unable to move it.
“It’s no use. We’re trapped,” he said. Then the floor split apart underneath us and we fell into a metal tunnel. I screamed as I slid down the metal tube, with Ron right beside me. Then the tunnel split into two and Ron went down one while I went down the other. I dropped from the ceiling into a room surrounded on all sides by thick walls of glass. The hole that I had fallen out of closed up, trapping me in the glass prison. I looked around and saw Ron in another glass prison right beside mine. He looked at me, and by his expression he was just as surprised and puzzled as I was.
Someone began to approach the glass prisons. It was Caesar! And he was carrying some sort of gun with a dart syringe containing an orange liquid loaded into it.
“Welcome, visitors!” Caesar said. “I’m so glad that you could join me in my humble laboratory.”
“Where’s John, Caesar?” Ron demanded. “Where’s my nephew?”
“He is quite alright. I would never do anything to hurt my experiment.”
“Your experiment?!” I practically screamed. “You shrunk him?! What the hell for?”
“That is something that I do not have to share with you. You are intruders to my lab, so now you’re going to become part of my studies.”
I really didn’t like the smile that was on his face.
~Torch~

1211322111121222111211121112121222121.content:
<Melissa>
He lifted up the gun and cocked it. I gulped as he approached my cell. What was he going to do to me? He raised the gun and stuck the tip of it in a small hole that I assumed was for air. I hadn’t noticed it before. The gun was aimed right at me; I looked back and forth frantically, but there was no way for me to escape. I was trapped.
In a blink of an eye, the gun fired and the dart hit me in the shoulder. I yelped in pain as the syringe stuck into my skin. Not only that, it had three barbs that had hooked onto my flesh. If I tried to remove it, I would rip off a large chunk of skin. The liquid had quickly drained into my blood stream and I expected to feel…something, but I felt nothing. I looked at Caesar as he pulled out a remote and pointed it at the dart. He clicked a button and the thick metal tip of the dart lit up. A surge of electricity went through me, numbing my entire body. My vision went black as I passed out.

I was lying on something soft and warm, and I could feel someone holding my hand. I opened my eyes and saw John’s face, looking down at me in concern. He looked completely normal. I reached up my hand and touched his cheek. He smiled and placed his hand over mine. For once I could finally see what he really looked like; I could see the long scar across his forehead and I could see the still-healing red burn from the cigarette on his wrist. His face was peeling in places from the burns he had received, but he looked healthy and was healing far better than I thought possible. He was the John that I remembered.
“John…are you big again?” I asked him. The smile on his face disappeared as quickly as it had come. He shook his head sadly, and it was then that I looked around at my surroundings. I could have screamed from the shock, but my voice had died in my throat. Everything, everything around me was huge, from the desk as big as a mountain, to the bed I was laying on that might as well have been a football field. The only thing that was normal was John, and then I realized: Caesar had shrunk me!
I looked at John, my eyes wide in fear and my heart thumping loudly in my chest. Then he spoke for the first time. “It’s ok, Melissa. Caesar brought you here after his experiment was a success. You’ll be safe here with me and Jenny.”
“Jenny?” was all I managed to say. Then I noticed the giant standing behind me at the foot of the bed. It was John’s sister, Jenny. A million questions exploded in my head, but I still couldn’t get over the shock of all of this. I sat up and looked at Jenny.
“I thought you were dead?” I said.
She shook her head. “I wasn’t.” Her voice was as loud as a megaphone. I flinched at the sound, but was reassured when John wrapped his arm around my shoulders.
“She’s not used to this like I am, Jenny,” he said. “You’re really loud to her.”
“Sorry,” Jenny said and blushed. I had always liked John’s sister; she was very kind and gentle. With a softer voice she spoke. “I wasn’t dead. Caesar brought me here and led me to believe that my whole family was dead.”
“Why? What’s the point of that?”
“We don’t know,” John said. “And now that he knows his shrinking formula works, who knows what he’ll do!?’
“Is there any way that we could escape? Ron came with me; he could help us get out if we find him, that is unless Caesar shrunk him, too.”
“I didn’t hear anything about Ron, but with Caesar you never know. I thought he only had one vial of the formula so Ron probably is still around here, more than likely normal sized.”
“At least one of us is,” I muttered. I had begun to appreciate what John had gone through. Now I could finally understand how he felt. I hugged my knees and tried to calm myself.
“I’m scared, John,” I whispered. “What’s going to happen to us?”
“I don’t know,” he replied, wrapping his arms around me. “But we’re going to be ok. Somehow we’ll get out of this.”
<Ron>
Shock. That’s all I could describe it as was shock. My old classmate, one who I had trusted enough with the life of my last living relative, had betrayed me and had been the cause of all that had happened to John and his family in the first place. Not only that, he had now shrunken Melissa! Was I next?
I paced the small white room that Caesar had put me in. It was like a refurbished prison cell; no matter how luxurious it was, I was still trapped. I had to escape and somehow find a way to reverse this. Was there anyone I could maybe contact to help us? My options were slim…
~Torch~

12113221111212221112111211121212221212.content:
<Ron>
I looked around the room, observing the makeup of it. The door was locked from the outside with what I guessed was an encrypted code. I couldn’t get out that way…or maybe I could. I walked to the wall beside the door and felt it with my hand. It was made out of fiberglass, or something similar to it. In the corner of the room was a chair with metal legs. Maybe I could use that. I walked over and picked up the chair, turning it so that its legs were facing away from me. Here’s where all those years of lifting weights paid off. I heaved the chair over my head and slammed it into the wall. It bounced back like I had done nothing, but a dent was left where I had hit it. Again I slammed the end of the chair into the wall. This time the fiberglass cracked, but didn’t break. Once more, I smashed the chair against the wall, and the fiberglass splintered and broke apart, revealing an interior metal skeleton supporting the wall. A control box was located in the exact position that I had broken through the wall. It was sealed with a hatch lock, but I could break that. I kicked at the lock repeatedly, until it broke free with a snap. The door of the control box swung open, revealing a tangled mess of wires and electrical systems. I smiled as the layout of the system came naturally to me. I knew exactly what to do.
After switching around a few wires, the door to the room opened up and I walked out. Forget calling the FBI; I’m going after Caesar. I ran down the white hallways. Gosh, didn’t this guy like color at all? He was disorganized enough. The hallway opened up into a large room full of computers and chemistry instruments. Caesar was bending over a table with his back turned to me, examining something. I ran towards him, grabbing a long bar that was on a counter on the approach. He turned around and looked at me with surprise as I grabbed his shirt and threw him onto the table, sweeping vials and flasks of liquids and different substances onto the floor.
“Listen here, Caesar! You’re going to show me where John and Melissa are and you’re going to change them back!”
Caesar just laughed. “Like I’m going to do that! My experiments are not for you to have.”
I lifted him from the table and slammed him into the wall. “Change them back, or else!”
“Or else what?” he sneered. I released him and swung the bar in between his legs, hitting him in the privates. He doubled over, falling to his knees.
“That’s what, f****** ba*****!”
“I still won’t change them back,” he squeaked in pain. I slammed my fist into his face, breaking his nose. Hot blood poured out and coated his face. He let out a string of cuss words and spit at me in insult. I heaved him up and slammed him onto a different table.
“I’m going to say this one more time,” I growled. “Change…them…BACK!”
I failed to see Caesar’s hand reach behind him and grab a flask. He flung the flask forward and it hit me in the cheek, cutting a long gash in it. I released him and stumbled backward in surprise. He immediately jumped to his feet and began chucking various vials at me. I ducked to avoid the first few, but one struck me in the arm and exploded. My arm burned as the acid began to eat away at my skin. I rolled behind a counter as more flasks flew past, breaking against the wall and spilling their contents. The barrage of projectiles suddenly stopped and I took the moment to leap out and attack. I jumped out from behind the counter to see Caesar finish loading a gun-like object. He pointed it at me before I could react and fired.
~Torch~
12113221111212221112111211121212221212.title: Ron the escapee

121132211112122211121112111212122212121.content:
<Ron>
The taser missed me by centimeters, hitting the wall instead. I leapt forward and brought the bar I was holding down on the wrist that was holding the gun. I heard a loud snap as Caesar dropped the weapon, his wrist broken. Caesar fell to his knees, whimpering.
“Enough!” he begged. “Please!”
I pointed the bar at him threateningly. “Change my nephew and Melissa back…now.”
“I…I can’t,” Caesar said. “The process is irreversible. I haven’t created anything to reverse it yet, and even if I did, it would probably kill them. There’s nothing I can do.”
I cussed at him and lowered the bar. “Fine! I’ll just take my family and leave.” As I turned around to walk away, Caesar grabbed my leg and tripped me.
“NO!” he hissed. “You cannot have my experiments!” He grabbed a scalpel off a table and went for my throat with it. I swung the bar upward, slamming it into Caesar’s temple. The madman crumpled to the ground, unconscious. I stood to my feet and grabbed the key card from around his neck, but my revenge wasn’t quite over. I kicked him in his side again and again until I felt his ribs give way and break. Then I took the bar and slammed it over and over onto his leg until his fibula and tibia were crushed and broken in several places.
“That’s for John you ba*****,” I snarled. It took all my mental resistance to not kill that man. I had better things to do than deal with him. After making sure he wouldn’t wake up for a long time, I got up and walked away. Now to find my family…
<Melissa>
“So Kendall’s really alive?” I asked John. He nodded in response.
“Yeah. He was one of Caesar’s first victims.”
“That son of a b****! How could he do that to Kendall’s family?”
“He doesn’t care about anything but completing his experiments,” John said. “I mean, look what he did to us.”
“Don’t remind me.” I still hadn’t gotten used to the fact that my old Barbie dolls were larger than I was now. John had told me everything that he knew about Caesar’s lab, including the colony.
“Is he going to put me in the colony?” I asked.
John shrugged. “I hope not. I don’t want to be separated from you.”
“Me neither. It’s frightening enough as it is. Now I know how you felt to be around us.”
He smiled at me, but his smile disappeared as the door beeped, signifying that someone was going to enter soon. Jenny placed her hand on the bed and John climbed on, but I remained where I was.
“Come on, Melissa,” Jenny said. “It’s ok.”
I stood up and looked at her hand, but it was as big as a car to me! I remembered how John had acted when I first found him; he was scared crapless. Now it was me, but there was nothing to be afraid of, at least not with Jenny. I knew she wouldn’t hurt me, but it was all just overwhelming.
John climbed down from Jenny’s hand and walked over to me. He grabbed my arm and gently pulled me towards Jenny. Reluctantly, I climbed onto her hand with him and Jenny raised us into the air. It was like riding a lift without railings.
Jenny stood up and walked away from the door; she wasn’t about to let anyone take her brother, or me for that matter, away from her. The door opened up and a figure walked in. It was Ron! Oh, gosh, I had never been more relieved to see him than now!
“Jenny?” Ron said in total amazement. “I thought you were dead?!” Jenny was probably getting sick of hearing that, but she ran to Ron out of joy. I was in awe of how something so large could move so fast, and I grabbed onto John as we ‘flew’ forward at what seemed like a hundred mph. Ron embraced her, being careful not to crush us.
“I missed you, Uncle Ron,” Jenny said. It was a genuine family reunion.
<John>
Ron pulled away fairly quickly, as though he had just remembered something important.
“We need to get out of here,” he said.
“What about Caesar?” I asked.
Ron smiled mischievously. “He won’t be bothering us anymore.”
I didn’t bother asking him what he meant. I knew how Ron got when his family was in danger. Caesar didn’t stand a chance. We exited the room and into the hallway, following the rows of tables to a door at the end of the room.
“I believe that leads to the upper floors,” Ron said. “We can get out from there.”
“Wait!” I yelled and Jenny came to a stop. Ron looked at me curiously. “We can’t just leave Kendall and the others in the colony,” I said. “We need to get them out, too. Maybe then we could convince the FBI or someone to arrest Caesar.”
“Err, ok, but I don’t know what you’re talking about,” Ron said in confusion.
“Caesar has a colony of shrunken people,” Jenny explained.
“Oh, that makes more sense. Where are they?”
I shrugged. “I have no idea. This place is like a maze.”
“How are we going to get them all out anyway?” Melissa said.
Ron thought for a moment. He looked around the room trying to come up with ideas. I could just imagine a light bulb appearing over his head as he clearly got an idea. He walked over to a table and picked up a bag. “This should work.”
<Melissa>
We exited the underground lab to the outside world, a thousand times bigger to me now that…well… Jenny still held John and me, and Ron carried the bag with the former occupants of the colony. Those people were so happy to get out of that prison. Kendall had been shaking in excitement at the possibility of him meeting his family again. Others were anxious to see their spouses or children. It was heartbreaking to see how many families Caesar had ripped apart.
Jenny followed Ron to the three-seat pickup that we had come to the lab in. Ron had paid a farmer $10,000 to borrow the truck for a few days. It just showed how much Ron loved his family; no price was too high for their safety. Jenny climbed into the passenger’s seat and held us near her chest. Ron got into the truck and gently placed the bag at Jenny’s feet for a secure spot. He started the truck and I could feel the engine vibrating through my tiny body. But before Ron could put the truck into drive, about fifteen black cars came screaming around the bend of the road and surrounded us. Men wearing sunglasses and carrying handguns jumped out of the cars and aimed…at us.
“Get out of the truck and put your hands over your head!” one of the men screamed at us. I looked at John who looked at Jenny who looked at Ron who was just as confused as all of us. Ron opened the door and slowly got out, placing his hands on the back of his head, but Jenny remained where she was. She obviously didn’t understand what was going on.
“You, too, girl!” the same man barked. Jenny, confused as ever, got out of the car, but she wasn’t sure on what to do. The men in black aimed their weapons at her like she was some kind of threat.
“Don’t point those things at my sister!” John yelled, but I doubt his voice would carry far enough for even Ron to hear.
The men approached us cautiously, always keeping the guns pointed at Ron and Jenny. They arrested Ron, pulling him into the back of an SUV. Two men came up to Jenny and grabbed her arms. Jenny tightened her grip on us in a reflex, making it hard to breath. The men forced Jenny’s hands open and I found myself in the grasp of one of the men in black. I struggled, calling out to John for help, but he couldn’t do anything. He had been taken by a different man. I briefly caught a glimpse of Jenny as she was also forced into an SUV before I was dropped on the seat of a car next to John. The door closed to the car, silencing the barking orders of the men outside. I sat up and looked around. We were in one of those cars that had the seats facing opposite from each other so that two people could talk face to face. John and I were on one side and two strangers were on the other. The first person was a man who looked to be somewhere in his forties. He had a bald head and a brown mustache. The person sitting next to him was a lady in her twenties. She had short black hair that parted over her pretty face and she was very curvy.
“You don’t need to be afraid of us,” the man immediately said. “I am agent Grant from the FBI, here to arrest Caesar Romano for the kidnapping of several US and European citizens. This is Dr. Renee Kelly,” he said, indicating to the woman sitting next to him. “She was a former assistant of Caesar’s. Dr. Kelly originally brought Caesar’s actions into light.”
“So you’re here to put a stop to Caesar’s insane plans?” John asked.
“That’s right,” Grant replied.
“Then why did you arrest my uncle and my sister? They weren’t doing anything!”
Grant looked taken aback. “You have to understand, we were mostly concerned for your safety and the safety of the other prisoners. We didn’t know who was helping Caesar or not. It was only a safety precaution.”
“Well, Ron was helping get us out,” I said. “Jenny was just another prisoner.”
“Don’t worry,” the woman said. “We’ll get it all taken care of once we get to where we’re going.”
“Which is?”
“Bern, in Switzerland. It should take us just about an hour.”
“Please tell us what you know about Caesar,” Kelly said. John folded his arms over his chest in defiance.
“Let Ron and my sister go first, then we’ll talk.”
~Torch~
121132211112122211121112111212122212121.title: Freedom!!!!!!!!!!

1211322111121222111211121112121222121211.content:
<Melissa>
Grant smiled and stepped out of the car. A moment later he returned with Ron and Jenny. Jenny immediately scooped John and me up, letting us sit next to each other on her palms. Ron was clearly irritated, grumbling to himself.
“Why did you arrest us?” he demanded of agent Grant.
“It was a precaution for the safety of Caesar’s victims,” he simply said. “I apologize for the misunderstanding.”
Ron sat next to John’s sister as the car began to move.
“Where are you taking us?” Ron asked, a little more polite this time.
“To Bern, Switzerland. We have a lab set up there to help reverse the, uh, shrinking process.”
“You know how to reverse it?” I exclaimed.
“Yes, but first we need to get some information from you,” Grant replied. “What do you know about Caesar?”
“Well, for starters he’s a crazy, delusional madman who likes shrinking people, but I suppose you already figured that out,” John said with a smirk.
“Caesar is in his lab unconscious,” Ron said, more serious than John. “I had to take him out to rescue my family.”
“He kept a colony of people that he shrunk, probably all the people he kidnapped.”
“And where are these people?”
“I had them in a bag in the front seat of the car before we were arrested,” Ron responded. “I don’t know if you found them or not.”
“Again, so sorry for the mix-up. Do you know why he was kidnapping these civilians?”
“He wanted the antibodies their bodies would produce to create a shrinking serum that would work on any living creature,” John said. “My blood had what he wanted and he successfully made the serum. He used it on Melissa,” he said while indicating to me.
“Then he has succeeded in creating a permanent serum,” Kelly said. She looked at us with something like sympathy, as if she understood exactly how we felt.
“What do you mean a permanent serum?” John asked.
“Well, to explain that we need to tell you Caesar’s history,” she replied.
“Caesar was hired by the US government for his extreme knowledge in science,” agent Grant said. “He was paid to create a shrinking serum that could be used for the defense of the country, and possibly create more room in prisons. Dr. Kelly was Caesar’s assistant, helping him out with the project. It was…mostly disastrous. Most of Caesar’s test subjects died, or experienced severely painful side effects, which eventually killed them, too. Caesar had been using animals for his test subjects and he wanted to move onto human testing, but we refused. Because of the lack of success of the project, we shut down the program. Caesar, extremely upset, became obsessed with finishing his experiment. He went on to work in secret, dragging Dr. Kelly into the process.”
“Caesar told me that a corporation in Europe had agreed to fund the process,” Kelly explained. “I didn’t know that he was lying at the time. He got his money over the black market. How, I’m not entirely sure, but he convinced me to help him continue his project. After about six months, we had success, but the effects of the shrinking process were not permanent. Sometimes the effects only lasted an hour before the subject returned to its original size. Caesar told me that he needed to get human subjects that contained certain antibodies that would produce the serum he needed to shrink whoever he wanted. Injecting nanobots into all people was just too expensive and the rate of survival was low. When I found out that he was serious with going through this plan, I tried to stop him. In turn, he shrunk me using the defective serum, but I managed to escape. Because of my antibody makeup, I was stuck your size for two years.”
“Two years?!” John exclaimed. “How did you survive?”
“I was very, very lucky. A poor farming family found me and kept me safe. They helped me contact some of my friends in the US. When I got home, I told the FBI and now we’ve been searching for Caesar ever since.”
“Well you’ve found him but now what?” I asked. “All the people he’s shrunk have permanent effects.”
“I’ve figured out how to reverse the process,” Kelly said. “After doing some research and creating a list of people that Caesar would kidnap, I came upon the Smithson family. John and Jenny, your bodies are both perfect for creating the shrinking serum and the reverse serum. Caesar never bothered thinking of a reverse to the process. I’m guessing he only kept you, Jenny, in case John died, but since you haven’t been affected by the shrinking process, your body has responded to the nanobots in your system by creating the reverse serum.”
“So we can get back to normal?” I said hopefully.
“Yes, but there is one problem; just like with the nanobots, the reverse serum might not bind with the body, although the chances of that are very slim.”
“I’ll take those chances!” John said. I had never seen him so excited.
<John>
I liked Dr. Kelly; she was very kind. After we had made it to Bern, agent Grant had given us a room to relax and unwind from the day’s events. It was very fancy, with three queen-sized beds, a 32 inch flat screen TV, and scented toilet paper! Everyone from the colony had also been given places to sleep, but theirs in proportion to their size. I was with Ron, Jenny, and Melissa.
I lay on one of the beds, relishing how soft it was, when all of a sudden, Jenny came running out of the bathroom and jumped on the bed. The mattress compressed and popped back up, sending me flying into the air. Needless to say, I screamed, probably like a little girl. Instead of spinning through the air, I went straight up, slowly flipping over until I was looking down at the sheets below. For a moment, I was weightless, like I weighed very much anyway, and then I started to rapidly descend towards the bed. A large object shot out as I fell and I found myself landing gently on Jenny’s hand. She dropped me on the bed before I could get over the surprise and stuck her face right next to my body, smirking.
“Don’t do that!” I yelled as she giggled.
“Oh, come on, John! Can’t we have some fun? Caesar’s going to jail, and tomorrow I’ll have my brother back!”
“What? You don’t like me tiny?” I smiled. She laughed.
“You’re fun, but I want to hug you without worrying about crushing you, and you still need to teach me how to play tennis.”
“Yeah, that’s kind of hard when the ball is bigger than me.”
The bathroom door opened up and Ron walked out, fresh out of the shower. “Alright, kids, get to bed,” he said.
“I’m not a kid, I’m an adult!” I replied jokingly, putting my hands on my hips.
“Yeah, you keep thinking that, Shorty,” Melissa said from the bed across from me.

Then my body went numb and my eyesight went black as I fainted.

“Five more minutes….” I mumbled. The headache had started to fade, leaving numbness in its place.
“Open your eyes you lazy bum!”

She ran to me and hugged me, and I kissed her over and over again.
Dr. Kelly walked out of the room and I went up to her, shaking her hand. “Thank you, thank you, thank you!!!!” I said.

THE END

I could no longer feel my fingers or toes. I just hoped that I wouldn’t lose them from frostbite. Daniel reached out his hand underneath the dumpster and grabbed me when I got close enough. I ducked my head onto his thumb to avoid bumping my head as he drew me out. I was immediately pelted by large white flakes of snow. The weather was quickly turning into a blizzard. Daniel opened up his coat and lowered me into one of the inside pockets. I was encased in darkness, but the heat radiating from his body felt oh so wonderful. It wasn’t long before I was shivering again; I shook as the numbness in my extremities faded and I gained back my sense of feeling. I could feel the muscles beneath Daniel’s shirt moving as he walked. I had no idea where he was going, but I hoped that he wasn’t going to try and walk all the way to my house in this weather. Something about him told me that he didn’t have a driver’s license.
Daniel stopped moving and I heard the faint click and squeak of a door opening and closing. I was jostled around a bit as Daniel seemed to bend down and move. The coat opened up and a hand descended upon me, wrapping around my body and lifting me out of my warm compartment. I couldn’t see where I was, but when everything stopped moving, I saw that Daniel had placed me on an old mattress that looked tattered and worn. I peered around, realizing that we were in a vehicle, probably an old van. The insides were rusted and the windows and sides were packed with insulation and cardboard. The back seats had been removed to make room for the bed and the only front seat left was the driver’s seat. I didn’t know why; there wasn’t even a steering wheel. Daniel was sitting across from me on the mattress. It was then that I noticed that his clothes were tattered and dirty.
“You’re homeless, aren’t you?” I asked.
Daniel nodded. “My parents died in a fire when I was about 8 years old. I’ve been living on the streets ever since. What about you? How did you get so small and how did you wind up out here?”
“I don’t know. Someone did this to me and tried to do it to the rest of my family, but my parents and my sister died from it. I can’t trust anyone anymore, not even my best friend. It’s her fault that I’m out here.”

“I really appreciate that, Daniel. You saved my life; thank you.”
“I always liked the Smithson family. Your dad donated a lot of money to the homeless shelter that I go to for food. I suppose that I can help his son out,” Daniel said with a smile.
~Torch~

151.content:
The sun began to set below the hazy, gray clouds, casting a red glow tinted gold against the sky. The driver of the car stopped in front of John’s house and we stepped out into the cold, frigid, November air. Snowflakes gently fell upon us as we walked up the steps and John unlocked the door to his house. I brushed the white powder off of my coat before stepping into the warm entryway of the home. John took off his coat and hung it on the coat rack next to the door. I did the same and followed him into the kitchen where the cook had prepared a meal for us. It was one of John’s favorites: Italian angel hair pasta covered in a cheesy, tomato sauce with garlic bread on the side. We sat down at the table, but John barely touched his food. Again, he sat there staring blankly, taking a bite of the pasta here and there. I could just imagine the cold blanket of grief that was engulfing his mind right now, but he seemed a little better than from the funeral. When dinner was over, Herald, John’s favorite butler, came and cleared the table. John pulled Herald aside and talked to him. “Will you tell the other workers that they can have tomorrow off?” John asked. “I want to have some alone time with Melissa so we can go through the house. Just for one day.”
“Of course, Master John,” Herald replied. “I will make sure it’s taken care of.”
“Thanks, Herald.”
John walked up to me and smiled. I could still see the sadness in his eyes, but he was definitely getting better.
“And you’re sure it’s ok with your parents that you stay here for awhile?” he asked me.
I nodded. “Yeah, it’s fine.”
“Ok, well you can sleep wherever you want. Do you need to go to your house and pick up anything?”
“No, I have everything I need already. I’ll just sleep in your little sister’s room.” John flinched when I said that, but he nodded in response.
“I’m going to go to bed early,” he said.
“Good, you need your rest. I’ll probably go to bed soon then, too.”
“Ok then, good night.”
“Good night.” I leaned over and gave him a kiss on the cheek. He gave a genuine smile before turning around and walking up the stairs to his room. I grabbed my bag from in front of the door with all my stuff in it and followed John up the stairs. His door was already closed with only a little crack open. I could hear his deep breathing as he slept and I realized that he probably hadn’t even changed before crashing. With a smile I turned and opened the door to Jenny’s old room, or John’s little sister. A dark mass immediately jumped on me, knocking me to the ground. A wet substance bombarded my face as I struggled to get the object off of me.
“Marco! Get off me you stupid dog!” I hissed. I pushed the black Labrador off of my chest and sat up, wiping the slobber from my face. They must have locked him in Jenny’s room. He was her dog after all. I pushed the dog away with my foot and picked up my bag from the floor, walking back into the room. Jenny’s room was a pale blue with butterflies painted on the wall and posters of puppies and kittens hanging over her bed and dresser. Her bed was piled with a variety of stuffed animals, concealing the SpongeBob mattress cover she had. Unlike my room at home, Jenny had always kept hers nice and organized. There were no clothes on the floor and no garbage littering the carpet. Her dresser had all her makeup in one part, her hair stuff in another, and all her jewelry was in the jewelry box. All her shoes were in her closet except for a pair of slippers by her bed.
It was so eerie to see everything in the exact place that Jenny had left them. It was almost like she was coming back, but she wasn’t. I shook the disturbing thought from my mind and dropped my bag on the floor near the foot of the bed. Before I could change and get ready for bed, Marco decided to sneak his way into the room and try to convince me to play with him. I grabbed the dog by the collar and dragged him out of the room and into John’s parents’ room, closing the door. That took care of that. But as I turned back to Jenny’s room, a wave of nausea suddenly hit me. I stopped, clutching my stomach as pain welled up in my abdomen. I expected it to go away, but it didn’t. Instead, it spread to my legs and chest until my whole body was in pain. I fell to my knees, groaning at the pain, but somehow unable to cry out for help. My vision blurred into a thousand colors and then went black. I didn’t feel myself hit the floor.

There was a dull throb in my head as I finally came to. I was lying on something extremely soft, but I didn’t open my eyes. I let the headache I had fade away as I tried to remember what had happened. Why had I passed out? It had come totally unexpectedly. Slowly, I pushed myself up into a sitting position and I looked down at what I was lying on. It looked like long white stalks of grass had been twisted together to form little tubes, but as I looked closer I saw that it was more of a type of fabric made up of thin, wiry strands of silver-white thread. I stood up, still looking at the ground and my feet sunk into the strange, soft substance so that it came up to halfway up my calf. Confusion whirled around in my brain. What was this stuff? And then I looked up.
Oh. My. Gosh…
Above me was the towering wall of fabric with jellyfish and flowers against a blue backdrop. I recognized it as the mattress cover of the bed. Even higher above that was the pale blue ceiling of Jenny’s room, but it seemed like a mile away. My heart thumped violently as I slowly turned around, looking at the rest of my surroundings. There were Jenny’s slippers, the size of a semi trailer each. Her dresser was a football field’s length away with its drawers rising into the air like a mountain. The soft substance I was standing on was the carpet in Jenny’s room. Everything around me had somehow grown to become immensely huge, and then the realization hit me. Nothing had grown; I had shrunk.
I sucked in a breath and tried to keep myself from panicking. Oh, gosh, how did this happen? It must have been something to do with what caused me to pass out. I had to think. What was I going to do? I had to get John’s help, but how? I couldn't be more than four inches tall, judging from the size of the slippers over there. But I had to make a decision.
~Torch~

My feet sunk deep into the field of carpet, giving me the sensation of walking through sand. I couldn’t wrap my head around what I was experiencing. I mean, honestly, how is this even possible?! I guess I couldn’t focus on that now; I needed to get John’s help.
Thank God that the door was open. Even better yet, the hallway floor was polished wood instead of carpet. The carpet felt nice to lie on, but was hard walking through. As I stepped onto the wood floor I took off into a run. The floor that usually creaked under my weight no longer made a sound, and my now tiny footfalls were muffled and faint. John’s room was right down the hall, about ten feet away, but to me, it seemed like miles. I stopped running a fourth of the way through, frustrated with myself for not keeping in shape like I used to be. The rest of the way I jogged or walked. When I reached John’s room, I was relieved to see that his door was open, too, but only about half an inch. With my body turned, I tried to squeeze through the crack, but I wasn’t skinny enough. Great, just my luck. I grabbed the side of the door and pulled with all my strength, but I just wasn’t strong enough. Then I heard a rumbling noise that I recognized as the furnace of the house kicking in. The warm air started blowing from the vent across the hall and I could hear the vent in John’s room start emitting air, just enough to force the door a little more open. Surprised at my change in circumstances, I squeezed through the now bigger crack and found myself staring up at the green walls of John’s bedroom. At the far end of his room to my left was a TV stand that held John’s X-box 360 and PS3. Above the game systems was his 52’ flat screen TV hanging on the wall in such a position that allowed him to play videos games or watch movies while lying on his bed. His dresser was to the right of me in the corner of his room next to his bed which stretched out in the center of the area with the headboard against the wall. A poster of John’s favorite football team hung over his headboard along with a shelf containing some of his valuables. In the far right corner of his room, John had a desk he used for homework and a place to set his laptop.
All of this I took in with a sharp breath, trying to contrast the difference that everything now was compared to me. Everything in this room I had seen a hundred times, touched a hundred times, and now they were a hundred times bigger. It made me feel insignificant. I could hear John’s breathing as he slept, but I couldn’t see him. He was probably wrapped deep within his covers like he usually was. And then the realization hit me: how was I supposed to wake him up? John had been known to sleep through his alarm clock going off at full volume without waking up for twenty minutes. He definitely wouldn’t hear me if I tried to call his name. But what if I managed to crawl onto the bed? Maybe I could wake him then. But what could I even do then? Tap him on the forehead? John didn’t even wake up when someone was shaking him. Maybe it would just be better if I waited until morning to try and contact him.
~Torch~
